comment.shortText: Parameters of the {@link Data | @Data} decorator and its flavors

A default value or a function constructing a default value.
Arrays or objects are supported, if you want to use a literal
function as a default value, use literal instead.

A default value. If a function is given, it will be passed as a
literal value instead of being executed as a factory.

The name of a vue property to sync this data property with.
On update to said property, the value of the decorated property
will be changed as well. on changes to the data property, an
`update:PROPNAME` event will be emitted, where PROPNAME is the
name of the property to sync with.
Parameters of the {@link Prop | @Prop} decorator and its flavors

A default value or a function constructing a default value.
Arrays or objects are supported, if you want to use a literal
function as a default value, use literal instead.

A default value. If a function is given, it will be passed as a
literal value instead of being executed as a factory.

Marks this property as a model property, if true is given, it
will use the event 'update:PROPNAME' as the binding trigger,
where PROPNAME is the name of the decorated property. If a
string is given, it will be used in place of the event instead.
Whether or not the property is required.
Whether or not the property is a two way property.

The type of the property. Should be a constructor function or
an array of constructor functions.

A validator function returning true if a given value is valid
and false otherwise.
A generator for {@link Snowflake | Snowflakes}
A generator for {@link Snowflake | Snowflakes}
Parameters of the {@link Prop | @Prop} decorator and its flavors

Configuration for a route, stripped down version of the actial config
used in "vue-router".

A unique ID generated from the current time,
an incrementing counter and some random elements.
A generator for {@link Snowflake | Snowflakes}

Declares a Vue property.
Boolean flavor of {@link Prop | @Prop} decorator

comment.text:
The property options to pass to vue, it can either be
 a constructor function like String or Number, an array of constructor
 functions or a property object {@link RecordPropOpts}.
 If a property object is given, in addition to the normal vue options
 some additional values can be provided.

comment.shortText:
Marks a function as blocking, setting a {@link BusyState} while in execution and
automatically blocking other functions marked with {@Blocking},
supports both synchronous and asynchronous processes.

tags.text:
Calling this method with an options object allows for parallel execution of otherwise conflicting
processes. It also allows for global / shared processes.
The corresponding busy state, in case of parallel execution,
will only be false if ALL started processes have finished.

comment.text: The id of the blocking process, if there are multiple non-conflicting processes.

comment.shortText: Binds a busy state used by {@link Blocking} methods to a vue reactive variable.

tags.text:
Calling this method with an options object allows for global / shared processes.
The busy state, in case of parallel execution,
will only be false if ALL started processes have finished.

comment.text: The identifier of a block state, if multiple exist.

comment.shortText:
Prefixes a css classes getter keys with a given
prefix and adds a css class to its body.
supports transforming object keys for conventional class names.

comment.text:
The class prefix to prefix object keys with.
 If none is given, it will default to the converted class name.

The infix to insert between prefix and key.
 By default this will be an empty string.

The converter used to convert object keys with.
 By default it does nothing.

comment.shortText:
Camel case specific flavor of {@link Classes} decorator.
Prefixes a css classes getter keys with a given
prefix and adds a css class to its body.
transforms the class name to camelCase and all members to PascalCase.

comment.text:
The class prefix to prefix object keys with.
 If none is given, it will default to the converted class name.

The infix to insert between prefix and key.
 By default this will be an empty string.

comment.shortText:
Kebap case specific flavor of {@link Classes} decorator.
Prefixes a css classes getter keys with a given
prefix and adds a css class to its body.
transforms the class name and all members to kebap-case.

comment.text:
The class prefix to prefix object keys with.
 If none is given, it will default to the converted class name.

The infix to insert between prefix and key.
 By default this will be two dashes (`--`).

comment.shortText:
Pascal case specific flavor of {@link Classes} decorator.
Prefixes a css classes getter keys with a given
prefix and adds a css class to its body.
transforms the class name and all members to PascalCase.

comment.text:
The class prefix to prefix object keys with.
 If none is given, it will default to the converted class name.

The infix to insert between prefix and key.
 By default this will be an empty string.

comment.shortText:
Snake case specific flavor of {@link Classes} decorator.
Prefixes a css classes getter keys with a given
prefix and adds a css class to its body.
transforms the class name and all members to snake_case.

comment.text:
The class prefix to prefix object keys with.
 If none is given, it will default to the converted class name.

The infix to insert between prefix and key.
 By default this will be two dashes (`--`).

comment.shortText:
Declares a Vue property.
Date flavor of {@link Prop | @Prop} decorator

comment.text:
The property options to pass to vue, it can either be
 a constructor function like String or Number, an array of constructor
 functions or a property object {@link RecordPropOpts}.
 If a property object is given, in addition to the normal vue options
 some additional values can be provided.

comment.shortText: Watch a property for changes, deeply

tags.text:
This decorator is synonymous to using {@link Watch} with `deep` set to `true`.
There are also flavors for these uses: {@link Watch}, {@link IWatch}, {@link IDWatch}

comment.text: The property to watch

comment.shortText: Declares a Vue data property.

tags.text:
There are various preconfigured flavors of this decorator for different
types already available:

comment.text: The data property options.

comment.shortText:
Debounce function calls by a specified amount of time
The function will only be executed `ms` milliseconds after
the last invocation. If it is invoked again within this
timeframe, the timeframe is reset. Useful for search completion.

tags.text:
If you want calls to execute the function immediately, then block
subsequent calls until a specific time is over, use
{@link Debuffer} instead.

comment.text: The amount of milliseconds to debounce it by

comment.shortText:
Debuffer function calls by a specified amount of time
The function will only be executed every `ms` milliseconds
Every call within this timeframe are blocked and the timeframe
reset. Useful for possible multiple event triggersn.

tags.text:
If you want calls to execute the function after the specified time
block subsequent calls, use {@link Debounce} instead.

comment.text: The amount of milliseconds to debuffer it by

comment.shortText: Delay function calls by a specified amount of time.

tags.text:
If you want to delay by one ms, a browser frame or a vue tick, look into
{@link NextMs}, {@link NextFrame} or {@link NextTick} instead.

comment.text: The milliseconds to delay calls by.

comment.shortText: Creates a computed property for {@link Document#querySelector} or {@link Document#querySelectorAll}

tags.text: Preferably use {@link Ref}

comment.text: The css selector to pass to {@link Document#querySelector} or {@link Document#querySelectorAll}
If {@link Document#querySelectorAll} should be used

comment.shortText:
Creates a computed property for {@link Vue#$el#querySelector | this.$el.querySelector}
or {@link Vue#$el#querySelectorAll | this.$el.querySelectorAll}

tags.text: Preferably use {@link Ref}

comment.text:
The css selector to pass to
{@link Vue#$el#querySelector | this.$el.querySelector} or {@link Vue#$el#querySelectorAll | this.$el.querySelectorAll}
If {@link Vue#$el#querySelectorAll | this.$el.querySelectorAll} should be used

comment.shortText: Emits a given vue event after execution with the return value being the event parameter.

tags.text:
If a promise is returned, it will trigger the event after the promise has completed successfully.
Will never emit on error, use {@link EmitError} instead.

comment.text: The name of the event to trigger, defaults to the method name

comment.shortText: Emits a given vue event after failed execution with the error being the event parameter.

tags.text:
If a promise is returned, it will trigger the event after the promise was rejected.
Will never emit on success, use {@link Emit} instead.

comment.text:
The name of the event to trigger, defaults to `error:METHODNAME`
where METHODNAME is the name of the decorated method.
If the error should be re-thrown after emitting the event

comment.shortText:
Emits a given vue event after the execution of the decorated method,
if a status code can be extracted from its return value or error.

tags.text: If a promise is returned, it will trigger the event after the promise was rejected or resolved.

comment.text: The status code to match, if none is given, it will emit on every status code

The name of the event to trigger, defaults to `status:STATUSCODE`
where STATUSCODE is the status code extracted from the return value or error of the decorated method.
If the error should be re-thrown after emitting the event

comment.shortText: Calls a function every `ms` milliseconds.

tags.text:
If you want to execute on every animation frame, use
{@link EveryFrame} instead.

comment.text: The milliseconds between executions

comment.shortText: Calls a function every animation frame.

tags.text:
If you want to execute in a specific interval, use
{@link Every} instead.

comment.shortText: Watch a property for changes, deeply and immediately

comment.text: The property to watch

comment.shortText: Watch a property for changes, immediately

tags.text:
This decorator is synonymous to using {@link Watch} with `immediate` set to `true`.
There are also flavors for these uses: {@link Watch}, {@link DWatch}, {@link IDWatch}

comment.text: The property to watch

comment.shortText: Wraps a function and only calls through if a given set of predicates return truthy

comment.text: The predicates to check before executing the decorated function

comment.shortText: Wraps a function and only calls through if a given set of predicates return falsy

comment.text: The predicates to check before executing the decorated function

comment.shortText:
Limit function calls to browser frames.
Useful for animations.
Every subsequent call before the next frame is blocked.

tags.text:
If you want specific time frames, look at {@link Debounce} or
{@link Debuffer} instead.

comment.shortText:
Declares a Vue property.
Number flavor of {@link Prop | @Prop} decorator

comment.text:
The property options to pass to vue, it can either be
 a constructor function like String or Number, an array of constructor
 functions or a property object {@link RecordPropOpts}.
 If a property object is given, in addition to the normal vue options
 some additional values can be provided.

comment.shortText: Delay function calls by a single browser frame.

tags.text:
If you want to delay by one ms, a specific time or a vue tick, look into
{@link NextMs}, {@link Delay} or {@link NextTick} instead.

comment.shortText: Delay function calls by a millisecond.

tags.text:
If you want to delay by a specific amout of time, a browser frame or a vue tick, look into
{@link Delay}, {@link NextFrame} or {@link NextTick} instead.

comment.shortText: Delay function calls by a vue tick using this.$nextTick.

tags.text:
If you want to delay by one ms, a browser frame or a specific amout of time, look into
{@link NextMs}, {@link NextFrame} or {@link Delay} instead.

comment.shortText:
Registers the decorated method as a vue event listener.
if more than one event is given, it will listen for multiple events
All event parameters are passed as arguments to the decorated method.

tags.text:
This decorator doesn't work for dom events, only for vue events.
If you want to attach to dom events, use {@link OnElement} instead.

comment.text: The events to listen for

comment.shortText:
Registers the decorated method as a dom event listener for the document object.
if more than one event is given, it will listen for multiple events
All event parameters are passed as arguments to the decorated method.

tags.text: If you want to attach to window, use {@link OnWindow} instead.

comment.text: The events to listen for

comment.shortText:
Registers the decorated method as a dom event listener.
if more than one event is given, it will listen for multiple events
All event parameters are passed as arguments to the decorated method.

tags.text:
This decorator doesn't work for dom events, only for dom events.
If you want to attach to vue events, use {@link On} instead.

comment.text: The events to listen for

comment.shortText:
Registers the decorated method as a vue event listener of the parent vue component.
if more than one event is given, it will listen for multiple events
All event parameters are passed as arguments to the decorated method.

tags.text:
This decorator doesn't work for dom events, only for vue events.
If you want to attach to dom events, use {@link OnParentElement} instead.

comment.text: The events to listen for

comment.shortText:
Registers the decorated method as a dom event listener for the parent vue component.
if more than one event is given, it will listen for multiple events
All event parameters are passed as arguments to the decorated method.

tags.text:
This decorator doesn't work for dom events, only for dom events.
If you want to attach to vue events, use {@link OnParent} instead.

comment.text: The events to listen for

comment.shortText:
Registers the decorated method as a dom event listener for the window object.
if more than one event is given, it will listen for multiple events
All event parameters are passed as arguments to the decorated method.

tags.text: If you want to attach to document, use {@link OnDocument} instead.

comment.text: The events to listen for

comment.shortText:
Creates a computed property for {@link Vue#$el#querySelector | this.$parent.$el.querySelector}
or {@link Vue#$el#querySelectorAll | this.$parent.$el.querySelectorAll}

tags.text: Preferably use {@link Ref}

comment.text:
The css selector to pass to
{@link Vue#$el#querySelector | this.$parent.$el.querySelector} or {@link Vue#$el#querySelectorAll | this.$parent.$el.querySelectorAll}
If {@link Vue#$el#querySelectorAll | this.$parent.$el.querySelectorAll} should be used

comment.shortText: Declares a Vue property.

comment.text:
The property options to pass to vue, it can either be
 a constructor function like String or Number, an array of constructor
 functions or a property object {@link RecordPropOpts}.
 If a property object is given, in addition to the normal vue options
 some additional values can be provided.

an optional type override if no type is specified
 using both provided options or reflected decorator metadata.

comment.shortText: Creates an accessor to a Vue reference.

tags.text:
If you need access to a dom node inside one of the children of this component
or one outside of it, you can use {@link El} and its flavours instead.

comment.text: The reference to bind to.

comment.shortText:
Registers a route for a given component
Decorator for components

tags.text:
If you want to use all registered routes, use {@link getRoutes}
as the value for `routes` of your router.

Only works if the file is imported before the router is initialized.
Requires "vue-router"

If you're looking for binding route parameters or queries to memgers
Use {@link RouteParam} {@link RouteQuery} {@link RouteName}.

comment.text: A route string or vue route config

comment.shortText:
Binds the current route name to a class member.
Decorator for properties.
On setting the decorated property, a navigation will
occur to the set route name using {@link Router#replace}.

Binds a route param to a class member.
Decorator for properties.
On setting the decorated property, a navigation will
occur to the current route with new params using
{@link Router#replace}.

Binds a route query to a class member.
Decorator for properties.
On setting the decorated property, a navigation will
occur to the current route with new query using
{@link Router#replace}.

Declares a Vue property.
String flavor of {@link Prop | @Prop} decorator

comment.text:
The property options to pass to vue, it can either be
 a constructor function like String or Number, an array of constructor
 functions or a property object {@link RecordPropOpts}.
 If a property object is given, in addition to the normal vue options
 some additional values can be provided.

comment.shortText:
Creates an observable state for the decorated property.
Every decorated property can then be used reactively in a vue context.

tags.text:
This is intended to be used outside of vue contexts in separate classes.
You can never set a decorated value to undefined, it will always be set to
null for reactivity reasons.
This is meant to be used when vuex is too much for what you are trying to
accomplish but some form of shared state is necessary.
For vue components, you should use {@link Data} instead.
Decorator

comment.text:
The state options, `default` being the default value or a
factory returning it, `literal` being the absolute default value,
functions being passed as is.

comment.shortText: Watch a property for changes

comment.text: The property to watch

comment.shortText: Merges multiple predicates into one.
comment.returns: A predicate that returns true if all other predicates have returned true.

tags.text: This function is meant to be a condition for {@link If} alike methods.

comment.text: The predicates to combine

comment.shortText: Creates a key converter function for use in {@link Classes}.

comment.text: The transformation to apply to the class name

The transformation to apply to the object key

{@link Classes} {@link ClassesCamel} {@link ClassesKebap} {@link ClassesPascal} {@link ClassesSnake}

comment.shortText:
Create a predicate that checks if the first parameter
of the returned function is equal to a given value at
a certain json path.
comment.returns: A predicate for use in `@If` and `@IfNot`

tags.text:
This function is meant to be a condition for
{@link If} alike methods.
If you want to check against a set of values,
use {@link isOneOf} instead.

comment.text: the path to look up in the returned object.
the value to check equality against.

comment.shortText:
A predicate that checks if the first parameter (assumed event)
is the first child of its parent node.
comment.returns: true, if the event's target is the first child of its parent.

tags.text:
This function is meant to be a condition for
{@link If} alike methods.
If you want to check if a node is the first element child of
its parent, use {@link isFirstElementChild} instead.

comment.text: The event to check against

comment.shortText:
A predicate that checks if the first parameter (assumed event)
is the first child element of its parent element.
comment.returns: true, if the event's target is the first child of its parent.

tags.text:
This function is meant to be a condition for
{@link If} alike methods.
If you want to check if a node is the first child node of
its parent, use {@link isFirstChild} instead.

comment.text: The event to check against

comment.shortText:
Creates a predicate that checks if its first parameter (assumed event) has
one or more given vue refs in its {@link Event#composedPath | composedPath}.
comment.returns: A predicate that returns true if all refs are part of the events composedPath.

tags.text:
This function is meant to be a condition for {@link If} alike methods.
If you want to check if one of many matches use {@link isOneInPath} instead.

comment.text: The vue refs to check against

comment.shortText:
A predicate that checks if the first parameter (assumed event)
is the last child of its parent node.
comment.returns: true, if the event's target is the last child of its parent.

tags.text:
This function is meant to be a condition for
{@link If} alike methods.
If you want to check if a node is the last element child of
its parent, use {@link isLastElementChild} instead.

comment.text: The event to check against

comment.shortText:
A predicate that checks if the first parameter (assumed event)
is the last child element of its parent element.
comment.returns: true, if the event's target is the last child of its parent.

tags.text:
This function is meant to be a condition for
{@link If} alike methods.
If you want to check if a node is the last child node of
its parent, use {@link isLastChild} instead.

comment.text: The event to check against

comment.shortText:
Creates a predicate that checks if its first parameter (assumed event) has
one or more given vue refs in its {@link Event#composedPath | composedPath}.
comment.returns: A predicate that returns true if one of all refs are part of the events composedPath.

tags.text:
This function is meant to be a condition for {@link If} alike methods.
If you want to check if all match use {@link isInPath} instead.

comment.text: The vue refs to check against

comment.shortText:
Create a predicate that checks if the first parameter
of the returned function is equal to one of many a given
values at a certain json path.
comment.returns: A predicate for use in `@If` and `@IfNot`

tags.text:
This function is meant to be a condition for
{@link If} alike methods.
If you only want to check against a single value,
use {@link isEqual} instead.

comment.text: the path to look up in the returned object.
the value to check equality against.

is a key event matching one of a given set of keys.

This function is meant to be a condition for
{@link If} alike methods.

comment.text: The keys to check against

comment.shortText:
Creates a predicate that checks if the first parameter (assumed event)
is a key event matching one of a given set of mouse buttons.
comment.returns: A predicate that returns true, if the event button is one of the given mouse buttons.

This function is meant to be a condition for
{@link If} alike methods.

was prevented with {@link Event#preventDefault | preventDefault}.

This function is meant to be a condition for
{@link If} alike methods.
